meanings.sent1: The doctor will extubate the patient after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: It is important to carefully extubate the patient to avoid any complications.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tube want to be extubated? It needed a break!
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to extubate the darkness as it rose over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle touch, the nurse began to extubate the patient, bringing relief.

meanings.sent1: The technician will extubate the machine to perform maintenance.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to follow the manual when you need to extubate the equipment.
meanings.sent3: The machine seemed to extubate itself, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: As the mechanic worked, he carefully extubated the engine, revealing the issue.
meanings.sent5: The process to extubate the device was complex, requiring precision and skill.
